New Records: Bradley Barcola scored the fastest-ever goal by a France player, taking 13 seconds
Key Match Events: Italy came back from conceding a goal inside 13 seconds to win 3-1
Federico Dimarco scored the equalizer with a volley in the 30th minute
Davide Frattesi scored the second goal for Italy five minutes after half-time
Giacomo Raspadori scored the third goal for Italy on 74 minutes
Pre-Game Insights: Michael Olise made his debut for France on the right wing
Manu Kone made his full international debut for France off the bench
Post-Match Reflections: Luciano Spalletti praised his team's reaction after conceding early
Didier Deschamps admitted France's performance was lacking
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match took place at the Parc des Princes in Paris
Italy will face Israel next in Budapest due to security concerns in the Middle East
France will hope to bounce back against Belgium in Lyon
Others: The result leaves Italy level at the top of Group A2 with Belgium
France had a disappointing Euro 2024 despite reaching the semi-finals
